 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">vi </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FIRST AMENDED AND RESTATED AGREEMENT OF 
</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>LIMITED PARTNERSHIP OF WORLD POINT 
TERMINALS, LP </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">THIS FIRST AMENDED AND RESTATED 
AGREEMENT OF LIMITED PARTNERSHIP OF WORLD POINT TERMINALS, LP dated as of 
[&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>&nbsp;], 2013, is 
entered into by and
between WPT GP, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, as the General 
Partner, and World Point Terminals, Inc., a Delaware corporation, as the 
Organizational Limited Partner, together with any other Persons who become 
Partners in the Partnership
or parties hereto as provided herein. In consideration of the covenants, 
conditions and agreements contained herein, the parties hereto hereby agree as 
follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE I </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>DEFINITIONS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;1.1 <I>Definitions</I>. The 
following definitions shall be for all purposes, unless otherwise clearly 
indicated to the
contrary, applied to the terms used in this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Acquisition</I></B>&#148; means any
transaction in which
any Group Member acquires (through an asset acquisition, stock acquisition, 
merger or other form of investment) control over all or a portion of the assets,
properties or business of another Person for the purpose of increasing, over the
long-term,
the operating capacity or operating income of the Partnership Group from the 
operating capacity or operating income of the Partnership Group existing 
immediately prior to such transaction. For purposes of this definition, 
&#147;long-term&#148;
generally refers to a period of not less than twelve months. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Additional Book Basis</I></B>&#148;
means the
portion of any remaining Carrying Value of an Adjusted Property that is 
attributable to positive adjustments made to such Carrying Value as a result of 
Book-Up Events. For purposes of determining the extent that Carrying Value 
constitutes Additional
Book Basis: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) Any negative 
adjustment made to the Carrying Value of an Adjusted Property as a result of 
either a Book-Down
Event or a Book-Up Event shall first be deemed to offset or decrease that 
portion of the Carrying Value of such Adjusted Property that is attributable to 
any prior positive adjustments made thereto pursuant to a Book-Up Event or Book-
Down Event; and
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) If Carrying Value that 
constitutes Additional Book Basis is reduced as a result of a Book-Down Event 
and the Carrying
Value of other property is increased as a result of such Book-Down Event, an 
allocable portion of any such increase in Carrying Value shall be treated as 
Additional Book Basis; provided, that the amount treated as Additional Book 
Basis pursuant
hereto as a result of such Book-Down Event shall not exceed the amount by which 
the Aggregate Remaining Net Positive Adjustments after such Book-Down Event 
exceeds the remaining Additional Book Basis attributable to all of the 
Partnership&#146;s
Adjusted Property after such Book-Down Event (determined without regard to the 
application of this <U>clause&nbsp;(b)</U> to such Book-Down Event). </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Additional Book Basis Derivative 
Items</I></B>&#148; means any Book Basis
Derivative Items that are computed with reference to Additional Book Basis. To 
the extent that the Additional Book Basis attributable to all of the 
Partnership&#146;s Adjusted Property as of the beginning of any taxable period 
exceeds the Aggregate
Remaining Net Positive Adjustments as of the beginning of such period (the 
&#147;<B><I>Excess Additional Book Basis</I></B>&#148;), the Additional Book 
Basis Derivative Items for such period shall be reduced by the amount that bears
the same ratio
to the amount of Additional Book Basis Derivative Items determined without 
regard to this sentence as the Excess Additional Book Basis bears to the 
Additional Book Basis as of the beginning of such period. With respect to a 
Disposed of Adjusted
Property, the Additional Book Basis Derivative Items shall be the amount of 
Additional Book Basis taken into account in computing gain or loss from the 
disposition of such Disposed of Adjusted Property. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Adjusted Capital 
Account</I></B>&#148; means the Capital Account maintained for each Partner as
of the end of each taxable
period of the Partnership, (a)&nbsp;increased by any amounts that such Partner 
is obligated to restore under the standards set by Treasury Regulation 
Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(ii)(c) (or is deemed obligated to restore under 
Treasury Regulation
Sections&nbsp;1.704-2(g) and 1.704-2(i)(5)) and (b)&nbsp;decreased by 
(i)&nbsp;the amount of all losses and deductions that, as of the end of such 
taxable period, are reasonably expected to be allocated to such Partner in 
subsequent taxable periods
under Sections&nbsp;704(e)(2) and 706(d) of the Code and Treasury Regulation 
Section&nbsp;1.751-1(b)(2)(ii), and (ii)&nbsp;the amount of all distributions 
that, as of the end of such taxable period, are reasonably expected to be made 
to such Partner
in subsequent taxable periods in accordance with the terms of this Agreement or 
otherwise to the extent they exceed offsetting increases to such Partner&#146;s 
Capital Account that are reasonably expected to occur during (or prior to) the 
taxable
period in which such distributions are reasonably expected to be made (other 
than increases as a result of a minimum gain chargeback pursuant to 
<U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(i)</U> or <U>6.1(d)(ii))</U>. The foregoing definition of
Adjusted Capital
Account is intended to comply with the provisions of Treasury Regulation 
Section&nbsp;1.704-1(b)(2)(ii)(d) and shall be interpreted consistently 
therewith. The &#147;Adjusted Capital Account&#148; of a Partner in respect of 
any Partnership Interest
shall be the amount that such Adjusted Capital Account would be if such 
Partnership Interest were the only interest in the Partnership held by such 
Partner from and after the date on which such Partnership Interest was first 
issued. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Adjusted Operating 
Surplus</I></B>&#148; means, with respect to any period, (a)&nbsp;Operating 
Surplus generated with respect
to such period less (b)&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;the amount of any net increase in Working 
Capital Borrowings (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of any net 
increase in Working Capital Borrowings in the case of Subsidiaries that are not 
wholly
owned) with respect to such period and (ii)&nbsp;the amount of any net decrease 
in cash reserves (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of any net 
decrease in cash reserves in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned)
for Operating
Expenditures with respect to such period not relating to an Operating 
Expenditure made with respect to such period, and plus (c)&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;the 
amount of any net decrease in Working Capital Borrowings (or the 
Partnership&#146;s proportionate
share of any net decrease in Working Capital Borrowings in the case of 
Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) with respect to such period, 
(ii)&nbsp;the amount of any net decrease made in subsequent periods in cash 
reserves for Operating
Expenditures initially established with respect to such period to the extent 
such decrease results in a reduction in Adjusted Operating Surplus in subsequent
periods pursuant to <U>clause&nbsp;(b)(ii)</U> above and (iii)&nbsp;the amount 
of any net
increase in cash reserves (or the </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of any net increase in cash reserves in
the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) for Operating Expenditures 
with respect to such period required
by any debt instrument for the repayment of principal, interest or premium. 
Adjusted Operating Surplus does not include that portion of Operating Surplus 
included in <U>clause&nbsp;(a)(i)</U> of the definition of &#147;Operating 
Surplus.&#148;
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Adjusted 
Property</I></B>&#148; means any property the Carrying Value of which has been 
adjusted pursuant to
<U>Section&nbsp;5.4(d)</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Affiliate</I></B>&#148; means, with respect to any Person, 
any other Person that
directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries controls, is 
controlled by or is under common control with, the Person in question. As used 
herein, the term &#147;control&#148; means the possession, direct or indirect, 
of the power to
direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a Person, 
whether through ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Aggregate Quantity of 
IDR Reset Common Units</I></B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in 
<U>Section&nbsp;5.10(a)</U>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Aggregate Remaining Net Positive 
Adjustments</I></B>&#148; means, as of the end of any taxable period, the sum of
the
Remaining Net Positive Adjustments of all the Partners. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Agreed Allocation</I></B>&#148; 
means any allocation,
other than a Required Allocation, of an item of income, gain, loss or deduction 
pursuant to the provisions of <U>Section&nbsp;6.1</U>, including a Curative 
Allocation (if appropriate in the context in which the term &#147;Agreed 
Allocation&#148; is
used). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Agreed
Value</I></B>&#148; of any Contributed Property means the fair market value of 
such property or
asset at the time of contribution and in the case of an Adjusted Property, the 
fair market value of such Adjusted Property on the date of the revaluation event
as described in <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(d)</U>, in both cases as determined by the 
General
Partner. The General Partner shall use such method as it determines to be 
appropriate to allocate the aggregate Agreed Value of Contributed Properties 
contributed to the Partnership in a single or integrated transaction among each 
separate property
on a basis proportional to the fair market value of each Contributed Property. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Agreement</I></B>&#148;
means this
First Amended and Restated Agreement of Limited Partnership of World Point 
Terminals, LP, as it may be amended, supplemented or restated from time to time.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Apex</I></B>&#148; 
means Apex Oil Company Inc., a Missouri corporation, and its Subsidiaries. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Apex Terminaling 
Services Agreement</I></B>&#148; means that certain Terminaling Services 
Agreement, dated as of [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>], 
2013, by and between the
Partnership and Apex Oil Company Inc. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New
Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Associate</I></B>&#148; means, when used to indicate
a relationship with
any Person, (a)&nbsp;any corporation or organization of which such Person is a 
director, officer, manager, general partner or managing member or is, directly 
or indirectly, the owner of 20% or more of any class of voting stock or other 
voting
interest, (b)&nbsp;any trust or other estate in which such Person has at 
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
least a 20% beneficial interest or as to which such Person serves as trustee or 
in a similar fiduciary capacity, and (c)&nbsp;any relative or spouse of such 
Person, or any relative of such
spouse, who has the same principal residence as such Person. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Available Cash</I></B>&#148; means,
with respect to
any Quarter ending prior to the Liquidation Date: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">(a) the sum of: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) all cash and cash equivalents of the 
Partnership Group (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of cash and 
cash equivalents
in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) on hand at the end of 
such Quarter; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) if the 
General Partner
so determines, all or any portion of additional cash and cash equivalents of the
Partnership Group (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of cash and 
cash equivalents in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) on hand 
on the date
of determination of Available Cash with respect to such Quarter resulting from 
Working Capital Borrowings made subsequent to the end of such Quarter; 
<I>less</I> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:8%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) the amount of any cash reserves
established by the General Partner (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate 
share of cash reserves in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) 
to:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) provide for the proper conduct 
of the business of the Partnership Group (including cash reserves for future 
capital
expenditures and for anticipated future credit needs of the Partnership Group) 
subsequent to such Quarter; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">(ii) comply with
applicable law or any loan agreement, security agreement, mortgage, debt 
instrument or other agreement or obligation to which any Group Member is a party
or by which it is bound or its assets are subject; or </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) provide funds for distributions under 
<U>Section&nbsp;6.4</U> or <U>Section&nbsp;6.5</U> in respect of any one or more
of the next
four Quarters; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>&nbsp;provided, however,</I>
that the General Partner may not establish cash reserves pursuant to 
<U>subclause (iii)</U>
above if the effect of such reserves would be that the Partnership is unable to 
distribute the Minimum Quarterly Distribution on all Common Units, plus any 
Cumulative Common Unit Arrearage on all Common Units, with respect to such 
Quarter;
<I>provided further,</I> that disbursements made by a Group Member or cash 
reserves established, increased or reduced after the end of such Quarter but on 
or before the date of determination of Available Cash with respect to such 
Quarter shall be
deemed to have been made, established, increased or reduced, for purposes of 
determining Available Cash, within such Quarter if the General Partner so 
determines. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding the foregoing, 
&#147;<B><I>Available Cash</I></B>&#148; with respect to the Quarter in which 
the Liquidation Date occurs and any subsequent Quarter shall equal zero. 
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Board of Directors</I></B>&#148; 
means, with respect to the General Partner, its
board of directors or board of managers, if the General Partner is a corporation
or limited liability company, or the board of directors or board of managers of 
the general partner of the General Partner, if the General Partner is a limited
partnership, as applicable. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Book Basis Derivative Items</I></B>&#148; means any item of
income, deduction, gain
or loss that is computed with reference to the Carrying Value of an Adjusted 
Property (e.g., depreciation, depletion, or gain or loss with respect to an 
Adjusted Property). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; 
text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Book-Down 
Event</I></B>&#148; means an event that triggers a negative adjustment to the 
Capital Accounts of the Partners pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(d)</U>. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Book-Tax Disparity</I></B>&#148; 
means with respect to any item of Contributed Property or Adjusted Property, as 
of the date
of any determination, the difference between the Carrying Value of such 
Contributed Property or Adjusted Property and the adjusted basis thereof for 
federal income tax purposes as of such date. A Partner&#146;s share of the 
Partnership&#146;s
Book-Tax Disparities in all of its Contributed Property and Adjusted Property 
will be reflected by the difference between such Partner&#146;s Capital Account 
balance as maintained pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.4</U> and the hypothetical 
balance of
such Partner&#146;s Capital Account computed as if it had been maintained 
strictly in accordance with federal income tax accounting principles. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Book-Up 
Event&#148;</I></B> means an event that triggers a positive adjustment to the 
Capital Accounts of the Partners pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(d)</U>. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Business Day</I></B>&#148; means
Monday through Friday of each week, except that a legal holiday recognized as 
such by the
government of the United States of America or the State of Missouri shall not be
regarded as a Business Day. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Capital Account</I></B>&#148; means
the capital account maintained for a Partner pursuant to 
<U>Section&nbsp;5.4</U>. The
&#147;Capital Account&#148; of a Partner in respect of any Partnership Interest 
shall be the amount that such Capital Account would be if such Partnership 
Interest were the only interest in the Partnership held by such Partner from and
after the
date on which such Partnership Interest was first issued. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Capital Contribution</I></B>&#148; 
means (a)&nbsp;any
cash, cash equivalents or the Net Agreed Value of Contributed Property that a 
Partner contributes to the Partnership or that is contributed or deemed 
contributed to the Partnership on behalf of a Partner (including, in the case of
an underwritten
offering of Units, the amount of any underwriting discounts or commissions) or 
(b)&nbsp;current distributions that a Partner is entitled to receive but 
otherwise waives. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Capital 
Improvement</I></B>&#148; means (a)&nbsp;the construction of new capital assets 
by a Group Member, (b)&nbsp;the replacement, improvement or expansion of 
existing capital assets by a
Group Member or (c)&nbsp;a Capital Contribution by a Group Member to a Person 
that is not a Subsidiary in which a Group Member has, or after such Capital 
Contribution will have, directly or indirectly, an equity interest, to fund such
Group
Member&#146;s pro rata share of the cost of the construction of new, or the 
replacement, improvement or expansion of existing, capital assets by such 
Person, in each case if and to the extent such construction, replacement, 
improvement or expansion
is made </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
to increase, over the long-term, the operating capacity or operating income of 
the Partnership Group, in the case of <U>clauses&nbsp;(a)</U> and <U>(b)</U>, or
such Person, in the case of
<U>clause&nbsp;(c)</U>, from the operating capacity or operating income of the 
Partnership Group or such Person, as the case may be, existing immediately prior
to such construction, replacement, improvement, expansion or Capital 
Contribution. For
purposes of this definition, &#147;long-term&#148; generally refers to a period 
of not less than twelve months. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Capital Surplus</I></B>&#148; means
Available Cash distributed by the Partnership in excess of Operating Surplus, as
described in <U>Section&nbsp;6.3(a)</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Carrying Value</I></B>&#148; means (a)&nbsp;with 
respect to a
Contributed Property or Adjusted Property, the Agreed Value of such property 
reduced (but not below zero) by all depreciation, amortization and cost recovery
deductions charged to the Partners&#146; Capital Accounts in respect of such 
property and
(b)&nbsp;with respect to any other Partnership property, the adjusted basis of 
such property for federal income tax purposes, all as of the time of 
determination; provided that the Carrying Value of any property shall be 
adjusted from time to time
in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(d)</U> to reflect changes, additions or 
other adjustments to the Carrying Value for dispositions and acquisitions of 
Partnership properties, as deemed appropriate by the General Partner. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Cause</I></B>&#148; means a court 
of competent jurisdiction has entered a final, non-appealable judgment finding 
the General
Partner liable to the Partnership or any Limited Partner for actual fraud or 
willful misconduct in its capacity as a general partner of the Partnership. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Certificate</I></B>&#148; means a certificate, in such form
(including global form if permitted by applicable rules and regulations of The 
Depository Trust Company and its permitted successors
and assigns) as may be adopted by the General Partner, issued by the Partnership
evidencing ownership of one or more classes of Partnership Interests. The 
initial form of certificate approved by the General Partner for Common Units is 
attached as
<U>Exhibit A</U> to this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Certificate of Limited Partnership</I></B>&#148; 
means the Certificate of
Limited Partnership of the Partnership filed with the Secretary of State of the 
State of Delaware as referenced in <U>Section&nbsp;7.2</U>, as such Certificate 
of Limited Partnership may be amended, supplemented or restated from time to 
time.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Claim</I></B>&#148; (as
used in <U>Section&nbsp;7.12(g)</U>) has the meaning given such term in
<U>Section&nbsp;7.12(g)</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Closing Date</I></B>&#148; means the first date on which 
Common Units are sold by
the Partnership to the IPO Underwriters pursuant to the provisions of the IPO 
Underwriting Agreement. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Closing Price</I></B>&#148; for any
day, with respect to Limited Partner
Interests of a particular class, means the last sale price on such day, regular 
way, or in case no such sale takes place on such day, the average of the last 
closing bid and ask prices on such day, regular way, in either case as reported 
on the
principal National Securities Exchange on which such Limited Partner Interests 
are listed or admitted to trading or, if such Limited Partner Interests of such 
class are not listed or admitted to trading on any National Securities Exchange,
the
average of the high bid and low ask prices on such day in the over-the-counter 
market, as reported by such other system then in use, or, if on any such day 
such Limited Partner Interests of such class are not quoted by any such 
organization, the
average of the closing bid and ask prices on such day as furnished by a 
professional market maker making a market in such Limited Partner Interests of 
such class selected by the General Partner, or if on any such day no market 
maker is making a
market in such Limited Partner Interests of such class, the fair value of such 
Limited Partner Interests on such day as determined by the General Partner. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Code</I></B>&#148; 
means the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended and in effect from time to 
time. Any reference herein to a specific section or sections of the Code shall 
be deemed to
include a reference to any corresponding provision of any successor law. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Combined 
Interest</I></B>&#148; has the
meaning given such term in <U>Section&nbsp;11.3(a)</U>. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Commences Commercial 
Service</I></B>&#148; means the date
upon which a Capital Improvement is first put into or commences commercial 
service by a Group Member following completion of construction, replacement, 
improvement or expansion and testing, as applicable. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Commission</I></B>&#148; means the 
United States Securities and Exchange Commission. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Common Unit</I></B>&#148; means a 
Limited Partner Interest having the rights and obligations specified with 
respect to Common
Units in this Agreement. The term &#147;Common Unit&#148; does not include a 
Subordinated Unit prior to its conversion into a Common Unit pursuant to the 
terms hereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Common Unit 
Arrearage</I></B>&#148; means, with respect to any Common Unit, whenever issued,
as to any Quarter within the Subordination Period, the excess, if any, of 
(a)&nbsp;the Minimum
Quarterly Distribution with respect to a Common Unit in respect of such Quarter 
over (b)&nbsp;the sum of all Available Cash distributed with respect to a Common
Unit in respect of such Quarter pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;6.4(a)(i)</U>. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Conflicts Committee</I></B>&#148; 
means a committee of the Board of Directors composed of two or more directors, 
each of whom
(a)&nbsp;is not an officer or employee of the General Partner, (b)&nbsp;is not 
an officer, director or employee of any Affiliate of the General Partner (other 
than Group Members), (c)&nbsp;is not a holder of any ownership interest in the 
General
Partner or its Affiliates or the Partnership Group other than (i)&nbsp;Common 
Units and (ii)&nbsp;awards that are granted to such director in his or her 
capacity as a director under any long-term incentive plan, equity compensation 
plan or similar
plan implemented by the General Partner or the Partnership and (d)&nbsp;is 
determined by the Board of Directors to be independent under the independence 
standards for directors who serve on an audit committee of a board of directors 
established by
the Exchange Act and the rules and regulations of the Commission thereunder and 
by the National Securities Exchange on which the Common Units are listed or 
admitted to trading (or if no such National Securities Exchange, the New York 
Stock
Exchange). </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Construction Debt</I></B>&#148; 
means debt incurred to fund (a)&nbsp;all or a
portion of a Capital Improvement, (b)&nbsp;interest payments (including periodic
net payments under related interest rate swap agreements) and related fees on 
other Construction Debt or (c)&nbsp;distributions (including incremental 
Incentive
Distributions) on Construction Equity. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Construction Equity</I></B>&#148; means equity 
issued to fund (a)&nbsp;all
or a portion of a Capital Improvement, (b)&nbsp;interest payments (including 
periodic net payments under related interest rate swap agreements) and related 
fees on Construction Debt or (c)&nbsp;distributions (including incremental 
Incentive
Distributions) on other Construction Equity. Construction Equity does not 
include equity issued in the Initial Public Offering. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Construction Period</I></B>&#148; 
means the period beginning on the date that a Group Member enters into a binding
obligation
to commence a Capital Improvement and ending on the earlier to occur of the date
that such Capital Improvement Commences Commercial Service and the date that the
Group Member abandons or disposes of such Capital Improvement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Contributed Property</I></B>&#148; 
means each property or other asset, in such form as may be permitted by the 
Delaware Act,
but excluding cash, contributed to the Partnership. Once the Carrying Value of a
Contributed Property is adjusted pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(d)</U>, such 
property or other asset shall no longer constitute a Contributed Property, but 
shall be
deemed an Adjusted Property. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Contribution Agreement</I></B>&#148; means that certain 
Contribution, Conveyance and
Assumption Agreement, dated as of [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>], 2013, among the Partnership, the General Partner, the 
Operating Company, the Organizational Limited Partner and CPT 2010, together 
with the additional
conveyance documents and instruments contemplated or referenced thereunder, as 
such may be amended, supplemented or restated from time to time. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>CPT 2010</I></B>&#148; 
means CPT 2010, LLC, a [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] 
limited liability company. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Cumulative Common Unit 
Arrearage</I></B>&#148; means, with respect to any Common Unit, whenever issued,
and as of the end of
any Quarter, the excess, if any, of (a)&nbsp;the sum of the Common Unit 
Arrearages with respect to an Initial Common Unit for each of the Quarters 
within the Subordination Period ending on or before the last day of such Quarter
over (b)&nbsp;the sum
of any distributions theretofore made pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;6.4(a)(ii)</U>
and the second sentence of <U>Section&nbsp;6.5</U> with respect to an Initial 
Common Unit (including any distributions to be made in respect of the last of 
such
Quarters). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Curative Allocation</I></B>&#148; means any allocation of 
an item of income, gain, deduction, loss or
credit pursuant to the provisions of <U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(xi)</U>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Current Market Price</I></B>&#148; 
means, as
of any date for any class of Limited Partner Interests, the average of the daily
Closing Prices per Limited Partner Interest of such class for the 
20&nbsp;consecutive Trading Days immediately prior to such date. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Delaware Act</I></B>&#148; means 
the Delaware Revised Uniform Limited
Partnership Act, 6 Del C. Section&nbsp;17-101, <I>et seq.</I>, as amended, 
supplemented or restated from time to time, and any successor to such statute. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Departing General 
Partner</I></B>&#148; means a former General Partner from and after the 
effective date of any withdrawal or removal of such former General Partner 
pursuant to
<U>Section&nbsp;11.1</U> or <U>Section&nbsp;11.2</U>. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Derivative Partnership 
Interests</I></B>&#148; means any
options, rights, warrants, appreciation rights, tracking, profit and phantom 
interests and other derivative securities relating to, convertible into or 
exchangeable for Partnership Interests. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-

Partnership and Enjet, LLC, a Texas limited liability company. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Eligible 
Holder</I></B>&#148; means a Limited Partner whose nationality, citizenship or 
other related status the General Partner determines, upon receipt of an 
Eligibility Certificate or other
requested information, does not or would not create under any federal, state or 
local law or regulation to which a Group Member is subject, a substantial risk 
of cancellation or forfeiture of any property, including any governmental 
permit,
endorsement or other authorization, in which a Group Member has an interest.

Limited Partner to execute as to such Limited Partner&#146;s (or such Limited 
Partner&#146;s beneficial owners&#146;) federal income tax status or 
nationality,
citizenship or other related status for the purpose of determining whether such 
Limited Partner is an Ineligible Holder. </FONT></P>

amended, supplemented or restated from time to time, and any successor to such

SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Expansion Capital
Expenditures</I></B>&#148; means cash expenditures for Acquisitions or Capital 
Improvements. Expansion Capital Expenditures shall include interest payments 
(including periodic net payments under related interest rate swap agreements) 
and related
fees paid during the Construction Period on Construction Debt. Where cash 
expenditures are made in part for Expansion Capital Expenditures and in part for
other purposes, the General Partner shall determine the allocation between the 
amounts paid
for each. </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-

top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>First Target Distribution</I></B>&#148; means $
[<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] per Unit per Quarter (or, with 
respect to the period commencing on the Closing Date and ending on [<FONT 
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>], 2013, it means the product of $
[<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] multiplied by a fraction, the 
numerator of which is the number of days in such period and the denominator of 
which is [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]), subject to 
adjustment in
accordance with <U>Sections&nbsp;5.10</U>, <U>6.6</U> and <U>6.9</U>. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Fully Diluted Weighted 
Average
Basis</I></B>&#148; means, when calculating the number of Outstanding Units for 
any period, a basis that includes (a)&nbsp;the weighted average number of 
Outstanding Units during such period plus (b)&nbsp;all Partnership Interests and
Derivative
Partnership Interests (i)&nbsp;that are convertible into or exercisable or 
exchangeable for Units or for which Units are issuable, in each case that are 
senior to or pari passu with the Subordinated Units, (ii)&nbsp;whose conversion,
exercise or
exchange price, if any, is less than the Current Market Price on the date of 
such calculation, (iii)&nbsp;that may be converted into or exercised or 
exchanged for such Units prior to or during the Quarter immediately following 
the end of the period
for which the calculation is being made without the satisfaction of any 
contingency beyond the control of the holder other than the payment of 
consideration and the compliance with administrative mechanics applicable to 
such conversion, exercise or
exchange and (iv)&nbsp;that were not converted into or exercised or exchanged 
for such Units during the period for which the calculation is being made; 
<I>provided, however,</I> that for purposes of determining the number of 
Outstanding Units on a
Fully Diluted Weighted Average Basis when calculating whether the Subordination 
Period has ended or Subordinated Units are entitled to convert into Common Units
pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.6</U>, such Partnership Interests and Derivative
Partnership Interests shall be deemed to have been Outstanding Units only for 
the four Quarters that comprise the last four Quarters of the measurement 
period; <I>provided further,</I> that if consideration will be paid to any Group
Member in
connection with such conversion, exercise or exchange, the number of Units to be
included in such calculation shall be that number equal to the difference 
between (x)&nbsp;the number of Units issuable upon such conversion, exercise or 
exchange and
(y)&nbsp;the number of Units that such consideration would purchase at the 
Current Market Price. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; 
text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>General
Partner</I></B>&#148; means WPT GP, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, 
and its successors and permitted assigns that are admitted to the Partnership as
general partner of the Partnership, in their capacity as general partner of the
Partnership (except as the context otherwise requires). </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>General Partner 
Interest</I></B>&#148; means the
non-economic management interest of the General Partner in the Partnership (in 
its capacity as a general partner without reference to any Limited Partner 
Interest held by it) and includes any and all rights, powers and benefits to 
which the General
Partner is entitled as provided in this Agreement, together with all obligations
of the </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
General Partner to comply with the terms and provisions of this Agreement. The 
General Partner Interest does not include any rights to profits or losses or any
rights to receive distributions
from operations or upon the liquidation or winding-up of the Partnership. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Gross Liability 
Value</I></B>&#148;
means, with respect to any Liability of the Partnership described in Treasury 
Regulation Section&nbsp;1.752-7(b)(3)(i), the amount of cash that a willing 
assignor would pay to a willing assignee to assume such Liability in an 
arm&#146;s-length
transaction. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Group</I></B>&#148; means two or more Persons that, with or
through any of their respective
Affiliates or Associates, have any contract, arrangement, understanding or 
relationship for the purpose of acquiring, holding, voting (except voting 
pursuant to a revocable proxy or consent given to such Person in response to a 
proxy or consent
solicitation made to 10 or more Persons), exercising investment power over or 
disposing of any Partnership Interests with any other Person that beneficially 
owns, or whose Affiliates or Associates beneficially own, directly or 
indirectly,
Partnership Interests. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; 
text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Group Member</I></B>&#148; means a member of the 
Partnership Group. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Group Member 
Agreement</I></B>&#148; means the partnership agreement of any Group Member, 
other than the Partnership, that is

incorporation and bylaws or similar organizational documents of any Group Member
that is a
corporation, the joint venture agreement or similar governing document of any 
Group Member that is a joint venture and the governing or organizational or 
similar documents of any other Group Member that is a Person other than a 
limited or general
partnership, limited liability company, corporation or joint venture, in each 
case, as such may be amended, supplemented or restated from time to time. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Hedge 
Contract</I></B>&#148; means any exchange, swap, forward, cap, floor, collar, 
option or other similar agreement or arrangement entered into for the purpose of
reducing the exposure of a
Group Member to fluctuations in interest rates, the price of hydrocarbons, basis
differentials or currency exchange rates in their operations or financing 
activities and not for speculative purposes. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-

the following: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-

Registrable Securities to whom the transferor of such Registrable Securities,

Holder at the time of such transfer, assigns its rights and obligations under

fiduciary or trustee of another Person owing a fiduciary duty to any Group 
Member; provided that a Person shall not be an Indemnitee by reason of 
providing, on a

</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT

otherwise. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Limited Partner</I></B>&#148; 
means, unless the context otherwise requires, each
Initial Limited Partner, each additional Person that becomes a Limited Partner 
pursuant to the terms of this Agreement and any Departing General Partner upon 
the change of its status from General Partner to Limited Partner pursuant to
<U>Section&nbsp;11.3</U>, in each case, in such Person&#146;s capacity as a 
limited partner of the Partnership; <I>provided, however,</I> that when the term
&#147;Limited Partner&#148; is used herein in the context of any vote or other 
approval,
including Articles XIII and XIV, such term shall not, solely for such purpose, 
include any holder of any Incentive Distribution Right (solely with respect to 
its Incentive Distribution Rights and not with respect to any other Limited 
Partner
Interest held by such Person) except as may otherwise be required by law. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Limited Partner 
Interest</I></B>&#148;
means an equity interest of a Limited Partner in the Partnership, which may be 
evidenced by Common Units, Subordinated Units, Incentive Distribution Rights or 
other Partnership Interests or a combination thereof (but excluding Derivative 
Partnership
Interests), and includes any and all benefits to which such Limited Partner is 
entitled as provided in this Agreement, together with all obligations of such 
Limited Partner pursuant to the terms and provisions of this Agreement; 
<I>provided,
however,</I> that when the term &#147;Limited Partner&#148; is used herein in 
the context of any vote or other approval, including Articles XIII and XIV, such
term shall not, solely for such purpose, include any holder of any Incentive 
Distribution
Right (solely with respect to its Incentive Distribution Rights and not with 
respect to any other Limited Partner Interest held by such Person) except as may
otherwise be required by law. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Liquidation Date</I></B>&#148; 
means (a)&nbsp;in the case of an event giving rise to the dissolution of the 
Partnership of
the type described in <U>clauses&nbsp;(a)</U> and <U>(d)</U>&nbsp;of the third 
sentence of <U>Section&nbsp;12.1</U>, the date on which the applicable time 
period during which the holders of Outstanding Units have the right to elect to 
continue the
business of the Partnership has expired without such an election being made and 
(b)&nbsp;in the case of any other event giving rise to the dissolution of the 
Partnership, the date on which such event occurs. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Liquidator</I></B>&#148; means one 
or more Persons selected pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;12.3</U> to perform the 
functions
described in <U>Section&nbsp;12.4</U> as liquidating trustee of the Partnership 
within the meaning of the Delaware Act. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>lower tier 
partnership</I></B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in 
<U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(xii)(D)</U>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Maintenance Capital 
Expenditure</I></B>&#148; means cash expenditures (including expenditures for 
the construction of new
capital assets or the replacement, improvement or expansion of existing capital 
assets) by a Group Member made to maintain, over the long term, the operating 
capacity or operating income of the Partnership Group. For purposes of this 
definition,
&#147;long term&#148; generally refers to a period of not less than twelve 
months. Where capital expenditures are made in part for Maintenance Capital 
Expenditures and in part for Expansion Capital Expenditures, the General Partner
shall determine
the allocation of the amounts paid for each. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Merger Agreement</I></B>&#148; has the meaning given
such term in
<U>Section&nbsp;14.1</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Minimum Quarterly Distribution</I></B>&#148; means $[<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] per Unit per Quarter (or with 
respect to the period commencing on the Closing Date and ending on [<FONT 
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>], 2013, it means the product
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">14 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
of $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] multiplied by a 
fraction, the numerator of which is the number of days in such period and the 
denominator is of which is [<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]), subject to adjustment in 
accordance with <U>Sections&nbsp;5.10</U>, <U>6.6</U> and <U>6.9</U>. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>National Securities 
Exchange</I></B>&#148; means an exchange registered with the Commission under 
Section&nbsp;6(a) of the Exchange Act (or any successor to such Section). 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Net Agreed Value</I></B>&#148; 
means, (a)&nbsp;in the case of any Contributed Property, the Agreed Value of 
such property or
other asset reduced by any Liabilities either assumed by the Partnership upon 
such contribution or to which such property or other asset is subject when 
contributed and (b)&nbsp;in the case of any property distributed to a Partner by
the
Partnership, the Partnership&#146;s Carrying Value of such property (as adjusted
pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(d)(ii))</U> at the time such property is 
distributed, reduced by any Liabilities either assumed by such Partner upon such
distribution
or to which such property is subject at the time of distribution, in either case
as determined and required by the Treasury Regulations promulgated under 
Section&nbsp;704(b) of the Code. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Net Income</I></B>&#148; means, for
any taxable period, the excess, if any, of the Partnership&#146;s items of 
income and
gain (other than those items taken into account in the computation of Net 
Termination Gain or Net Termination Loss) for such taxable period over the 
Partnership&#146;s items of loss and deduction (other than those items taken 
into account in the
computation of Net Termination Gain or Net Termination Loss) for such taxable 
period. The items included in the calculation of Net Income shall be determined 
in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(b)</U> and shall not include any items 
specially
allocated under <U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)</U>; <I>provided, however,</I> that the 
determination of the items that have been specially allocated under 
<U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)</U> shall be made without regard to any reversal of such 
items under
<U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(xii)</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Net Loss</I></B>&#148; means, for any taxable period, the 
excess, if any, of the
Partnership&#146;s items of loss and deduction (other than those items taken 
into account in the computation of Net Termination Gain or Net Termination Loss)
for such taxable period over the Partnership&#146;s items of income and gain 
(other than
those items taken into account in the computation of Net Termination Gain or Net
Termination Loss) for such taxable period. The items included in the calculation
of Net Loss shall be determined in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(b)</U> 
and shall
not include any items specially allocated under <U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)</U>; 
<I>provided, however,</I> that the determination of the items that have been 
specially allocated under <U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)</U> shall be made without 
regard to any
reversal of such items under <U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)(xii)</U>. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Net Positive 
Adjustments</I></B>&#148; means, with
respect to any Partner, the excess, if any, of the total positive adjustments 
over the total negative adjustments made to the Capital Account of such Partner 
pursuant to Book-Up Events and Book-Down Events. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Net Termination Gain</I></B>&#148; 
means, for any taxable period, the sum, if positive, of all items of income, 
gain, loss or
deduction (determined in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(b)</U>) that are 
(a)&nbsp;recognized by the Partnership (i)&nbsp;after the Liquidation Date or 
(ii)&nbsp;upon the sale, exchange or other disposition of all or substantially 
all of the
assets of the Partnership Group, taken as a whole, in a single transaction or a 
series of related transactions (excluding any disposition to a </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">15 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
member of the Partnership Group), or (b)&nbsp;deemed recognized by the 
Partnership pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(d)</U>; <I>provided, however, 
</I>that the items included in the determination
of Net Termination Gain shall not include any items of income, gain or loss 
specially allocated under <U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)</U>. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Net Termination 
Loss</I></B>&#148; means, for any taxable period, the sum, if negative, of all 
items of income, gain, loss or deduction (determined in accordance with
<U>Section&nbsp;5.4(b)</U>) that are (a)&nbsp;recognized by the Partnership 
(i)&nbsp;after the Liquidation Date or (ii)&nbsp;upon the sale, exchange or 
other disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the Partnership 
Group, taken as a
whole, in a single transaction or a series of related transactions (excluding 
any disposition to a member of the Partnership Group), or (b)&nbsp;deemed 
recognized by the Partnership pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;5.4(b)</U>; 
<I>provided, however,
</I>that the items included in the determination of Net Termination Loss shall 
not include any items of income, gain or loss specially allocated under 
<U>Section&nbsp;6.1(d)</U>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Nonrecourse Built-in 
Gain</I></B>&#148; means with respect to any Contributed Properties or Adjusted 
Properties that are
subject to a mortgage or pledge securing a Nonrecourse Liability, the amount of 
any taxable gain that would be allocated to the Partners pursuant to 
<U>Section&nbsp;6.2(b)</U> if such properties were disposed of in a taxable 
transaction in full
satisfaction of such liabilities and for no other consideration. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Nonrecourse 
Deductions</I></B>&#148; means any
and all items of loss, deduction or expenditure (including any expenditure 
described in Section&nbsp;705(a)(2)(B) of the Code) that, in accordance with the
principles of Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.704-2(b), are attributable to a
Nonrecourse
Liability. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Nonrecourse Liability</I></B>&#148; has the meaning set 
forth in Treasury Regulation
Section&nbsp;1.752-1(a)(2). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Notice</I></B>&#148; means a written request from a Holder 
pursuant to
<U>Section&nbsp;7.12</U> which shall (a)&nbsp;specify the Registrable Securities
intended to be registered, offered and sold by such Holder, (b)&nbsp;describe 
the nature or method of the proposed offer and sale of Registrable Securities, 
and
(c)&nbsp;contain the undertaking of such Holder to provide all such information 
and materials and take all action as may be required or appropriate in order to 
permit the Partnership to comply with all applicable requirements and 
obligations in
connection with the registration and disposition of such Registrable Securities 
pursuant to <U>Section&nbsp;7.12</U>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Notice of Election to 
Purchase</I></B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in 
<U>Section&nbsp;15.1(b)</U>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Omnibus Agreement</I></B>&#148; 
means that certain Omnibus Agreement, dated as of
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>], 2013, among Apex Oil 
Company Inc., World Point Parent, the General Partner, the Partnership and the 
Operating Company, as such agreement may be amended, supplemented or restated 
from time to
time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Operating Company</I></B>&#148; means Center Point Terminal
Company, LLC, a Delaware limited liability
company, and any successors thereto. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">16 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Operating 
Expenditures</I></B>&#148; means all Partnership Group cash
expenditures (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of expenditures in 
the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned), including taxes, 
compensation of employees, officers and directors of the General Partner, 
reimbursement of expenses
of the General Partner and its Affiliates, debt service payments, Maintenance 
Capital Expenditures, repayment of Working Capital Borrowings and payments made 
in the ordinary course of business under any Hedge Contracts, subject to the 
following:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) repayments of Working Capital 
Borrowings deducted from Operating Surplus pursuant to <U>clause&nbsp;(b)
(iii)</U> of the
definition of &#147;Operating Surplus&#148; shall not constitute Operating 
Expenditures when actually repaid; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">(b) payments
(including prepayments and prepayment penalties) of principal of and premium on 
indebtedness other than Working Capital Borrowings shall not constitute 
Operating Expenditures; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;
text-indent:8%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) Operating Expenditures shall 
not include (i)&nbsp;Expansion Capital Expenditures, (ii)&nbsp;payment of 
transaction expenses (including taxes) relating to Interim Capital Transactions,
(iii)&nbsp;distributions to Partners, (iv)&nbsp;repurchases of Partnership 
Interests, other than repurchases of Partnership Interests by the Partnership to
satisfy obligations under employee benefit plans or reimbursement of expenses of
the General
Partner for purchases of Partnership Interests by the General Partner to satisfy
obligations under employee benefit plans, or (v)&nbsp;any other expenditures or 
payments using the proceeds of the Initial Public Offering as described under 
&#147;Use
of Proceeds&#148; in the IPO Registration Statement; and </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) (i)&nbsp;amounts paid in connection with 
the initial purchase of
a Hedge Contract shall be amortized over the life of such Hedge Contract and 
(ii)&nbsp;payments made in connection with the termination of any Hedge Contract
prior to the expiration of its scheduled settlement or termination date shall be
included
in equal quarterly installments over the remaining scheduled life of such Hedge 
Contract. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Operating
Surplus</I></B>&#148; means, with respect to any period ending prior to the 
Liquidation Date, on a cumulative basis and without duplication, </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) the sum of (i)&nbsp;$[<FONT 
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] million, (ii)&nbsp;all cash 
receipts of the Partnership Group (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share
of cash receipts
in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) for the period beginning 
on the Closing Date and ending on the last day of such period, but excluding 
cash receipts from Interim Capital Transactions and the termination of Hedge 
Contracts
(provided that cash receipts from the termination of a Hedge Contract prior to 
its scheduled settlement or termination date shall be included in Operating 
Surplus in equal quarterly installments over the remaining scheduled life of 
such Hedge
Contract), (iii)&nbsp;all cash receipts of the Partnership Group (or the 
Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of cash receipts in the case of 
Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) after the end of such period but on or 
before the date of
determination of Operating Surplus with respect to such period resulting from 
Working Capital Borrowings and (iv)&nbsp;the amount of cash distributions from 
Operating Surplus paid during the Construction Period (including incremental 
Incentive
Distributions) on Construction Equity, <I>less</I> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">(b) the sum of (i)&nbsp;Operating Expenditures for the period 
beginning on
the Closing Date and ending on the last day of such period, (ii)&nbsp;the amount
of cash reserves (or the Partnership&#146;s proportionate share of cash reserves
in the case of Subsidiaries that are not wholly owned) established by the 
General
Partner to provide funds for future Operating Expenditures, and (iii)&nbsp;all 
Working Capital Borrowings not repaid within twelve months after having been 
incurred, or repaid within such 12-month period with the proceeds of additional 
Working
Capital Borrowings;<I> provided, however,</I> that disbursements made (including
contributions to a Group Member or disbursements on behalf of a Group Member) or
cash reserves established, increased or reduced after the end of such period but
on or
before the date of determination of Available Cash with respect to such period 
shall be deemed to have been made, established, increased or reduced, for
purposes of determining Operating Surplus, within such period if the General 
Partner so
determines. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">17 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding the foregoing, &#147;Operating 
Surplus&#148; with respect to the Quarter in
which the Liquidation Date occurs and any subsequent Quarter shall equal zero. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Opinion of 
Counsel</I></B>&#148;
means a written opinion of counsel (who may be regular counsel to the 
Partnership or the General Partner or any of its Affiliates) acceptable to the 
General Partner or to such other person selecting such counsel or obtaining such
opinion.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Option Closing 
Date</I></B>&#148; means the date or dates on which any Common Units are sold by
the Partnership
to the IPO Underwriters upon exercise of the Over-Allotment Option. </FONT></P> 
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Organizational Limited 
Partner</I></B>&#148;
means World Point Parent in its capacity as the organizational limited partner 
of the Partnership pursuant to this Agreement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Outstanding</I></B>&#148; means, 
with respect to Partnership Interests, all Partnership Interests that are issued
by the
Partnership and reflected as outstanding on the Partnership&#146;s books and 
records as of the date of determination; <I>provided, however,</I> that if at 
any time any Person or Group (other than the General Partner or its Affiliates) 
beneficially
owns 20% or more of the Outstanding Partnership Interests of any class, all 
Partnership Interests owned by or for the benefit of such Person or Group shall 
not be entitled to be voted on any matter and shall not be considered to be 
Outstanding when
sending notices of a meeting of Limited Partners to vote on any matter (unless 
otherwise required by law), calculating required votes, determining the presence
of a quorum or for other similar purposes under this Agreement, except that 
Partnership
Interests so owned shall be considered to be Outstanding for purposes of 
<U>Section&nbsp;11.1(b)(iv)</U> (such Partnership Interests shall not, however, 
be treated as a separate class of Partnership Interests for purposes of this 
Agreement or the
Delaware Act); <I>provided further,</I> that the foregoing limitation shall not 
apply to (i)&nbsp;any Person or Group who acquired 20% or more of the 
Outstanding Partnership Interests of any class directly from the General Partner
or its Affiliates
(other than the Partnership), (ii)&nbsp;any Person or Group who acquired 20% or 
more of the Outstanding Partnership Interests of any class then Outstanding 
directly or indirectly from a Person or Group described in <U>clause&nbsp;
(i)</U>, provided
that, upon or prior to such acquisition, the General Partner shall have notified
such Person or </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">18 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
Group in writing that such limitation shall not apply, or (iii)&nbsp;any Person 
or Group who acquired 20% or more of any Partnership Interests issued by the 
Partnership with the prior approval of
the Board of Directors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;
text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Over-Allotment Option</I></B>&#148; means the over-
allotment option granted to the IPO
Underwriters by the Partnership pursuant to the IPO Underwriting Agreement. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Partner Nonrecourse
Debt</I></B>&#148; has the meaning set forth in Treasury Regulation 
Section&nbsp;1.704-2(b)(4). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Partner
Nonrecourse Debt Minimum Gain</I></B>&#148; has the meaning set forth in 
Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.704-2(i)(2). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Partner Nonrecourse 
Deductions</I></B>&#148; means any and all items of loss, deduction or 
expenditure (including any
expenditure described in Section&nbsp;705(a)(2)(B) of the Code) that, in 
accordance with the principles of Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.704-2(i), 
are attributable to a Partner Nonrecourse Debt. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Partners</I></B>&#148; means the 
General Partner and the Limited Partners. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Partnership</I></B>&#148; means 
World Point Terminals, LP, a Delaware limited partnership. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Partnership Group</I></B>&#148; 
means, collectively, the Partnership and its Subsidiaries. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Partnership Interest</I></B>&#148; 
means any interest, including any class or series of equity interest, in the 
Partnership,
which shall include any Limited Partner Interests and the General Partner 
Interest but shall exclude any Derivative Partnership Interests. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Partnership Minimum 
Gain</I></B>&#148; means that amount determined in accordance with the 
principles of Treasury Regulation Sections&nbsp;1.704-2(b)(2) and 1.704-2(d). 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Partnership Register</I></B>&#148; 
means a register maintained on behalf of the Partnership by the General Partner,
or, if
the General Partner so determines, by the Transfer Agent as part of the Transfer
Agent&#146;s books and transfer records, with respect to each class of 
Partnership Interests in which all Record Holders and transfers of such class of
Partnership
Interests are registered or otherwise recorded. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Per Unit Capital Amount</I></B>&#148; means, as of 
any date of
determination, the Capital Account, stated on a per Unit basis, underlying any
Unit held by a Person other than the General Partner or any Affiliate of the 
General Partner who holds Units. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Percentage Interest</I></B>&#148; 
means, as of any date of determination, (a)&nbsp;as to any Unitholder with 
respect to
Units, the product obtained by multiplying (i)&nbsp;100% less the percentage 
applicable to <U>clause&nbsp;(b)</U> below by (ii)&nbsp;the quotient obtained by
dividing (A)&nbsp;the number of Units held by such Unitholder, by (B)&nbsp;the 
total number
of Outstanding Units, and (b)&nbsp;as to the holders of other Partnership 
Interests issued by the Partnership in accordance with <U>Section&nbsp;5.5</U>, 
the percentage established as a part of such issuance. The Percentage Interest 
with respect to
an Incentive Distribution Right and the General Partner Interest shall at all 
times be zero. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">19 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Person</I></B>&#148; means an 
individual or a corporation, firm, limited
liability company, partnership, joint venture, trust, unincorporated 
organization, association, government agency or political subdivision thereof or
other entity. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Plan of 
Conversion</I></B>&#148; has the meaning given such term in 
<U>Section&nbsp;14.1</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<B><I>Pro Rata</I></B>&#148; 
means (a)&nbsp;when used with respect to Units or any class thereof, apportioned
