without regard to the principles of conflicts of law. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:8%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) Each of the Partners and each Person or 
Group holding any beneficial interest in the Partnership (whether through a 
broker, dealer,
bank, trust company or clearing corporation or an agent of any of the foregoing 
or otherwise): </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) irrevocably 
agrees that
any claims, suits, actions or proceedings (A)&nbsp;arising out of or relating in
any way to this Agreement (including any claims, suits or actions to interpret, 
apply or enforce the provisions of this Agreement or the duties, obligations or
liabilities among Partners or of Partners to the Partnership, or the rights or 
powers of, or restrictions on, the Partners or the Partnership), 
(B)&nbsp;brought in a derivative manner on behalf of the Partnership, 
(C)&nbsp;asserting a claim of
breach of a duty owed by any director, officer, or other employee of the 
Partnership or the General Partner, or owed by the General Partner, to the 
Partnership or the Partners, (D)&nbsp;asserting a claim arising pursuant to any 
provision of the
Delaware Act or (E)&nbsp;asserting a claim governed by the internal affairs 
doctrine shall be brought in the Court of Chancery of the State of Delaware, in 
each case regardless of whether such claims, suits, actions or proceedings sound
in contract,
tort, fraud or otherwise, are based on common law, statutory, equitable, legal 
or other grounds, or are derivative or direct claims; <I>provided, however</I>, 
any claims, suits, actions or proceedings over which the Court of Chancery of 
the State of
Delaware does not have jurisdiction shall be brought in any other court in the 
State of Delaware having jurisdiction; </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">104
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) irrevocably submits to the exclusive 
jurisdiction of the Court of Chancery of the
State of Delaware in connection with any such claim, suit, action or proceeding;
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) agrees not to, and waives any
right
to, assert in any such claim, suit, action or proceeding that (A)&nbsp;it is not
personally subject to the jurisdiction of the Court of Chancery of the State of 
Delaware or of any other court to which proceedings in the Court of Chancery of
the
State of Delaware may be appealed, (B)&nbsp;such claim, suit, action or 
proceeding is brought in an inconvenient forum, or (C)&nbsp;the venue of such 
claim, suit, action or proceeding is improper; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv) expressly waives any requirement for the 
posting of a bond by a party bringing such claim, suit, action or proceeding; 
and
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:13%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(v) consents to process being 
served in any such claim, suit, action or proceeding by mailing, certified mail,
return
receipt requested, a copy thereof to such party at the address in effect for 
notices hereunder, and agrees that such services shall constitute good and 
sufficient service of process and notice thereof; <I>provided, however</I>, that
nothing in this
<U>clause&nbsp;(v)</U> hereof shall affect or limit any right to serve process 
in any other manner permitted by law. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;16.10 <I>Invalidity of 
Provisions</I>. If any provision or part of a provision of this Agreement is or 
becomes for any
reason, invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any respect, the validity, legality
and enforceability of the remaining provisions and/or parts thereof contained 
herein shall not be affected thereby and this Agreement shall, to the fullest 
extent
permitted by law, be reformed and construed as if such invalid, illegal or 
unenforceable provision, or part of a provision, had never been contained 
herein, and such provisions and/or part shall be reformed so that it would be 
valid, legal and
enforceable to the maximum extent possible. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;16.11 <I>Consent of Partners</I>. Each Partner 
hereby expressly
consents and agrees that, whenever in this Agreement it is specified that an 
action may be taken upon the affirmative vote or consent of less than all of the
Partners, such action may be so taken upon the concurrence of less than all of 
the Partners
and each Partner shall be bound by the results of such action. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;16.12 <I>Facsimile and Email 
Signatures</I>. The
use of facsimile signatures and signatures delivered by email in portable 
document format (.pdf) affixed in the name and on behalf of the transfer agent 
and registrar of the Partnership on certificates representing Common Units is 
expressly
permitted by this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">Section&nbsp;16.13 <I>Interpretation</I>. In the event of any ambiguity
or question of intent or
interpretation arises, this Agreement will be construed as if drafted jointly by
the Partners and no presumption or burden of proof will arise favoring or 
disfavoring any Partner by virtue of the authorship or any of the provisions of 
this
Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>[REMAINDER 
OF THIS PAGE INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK.] </I></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">105
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B>, the parties hereto have executed this
Agreement as of the date first written
above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Signature Page to First Amended 
and Restated Agreement of </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Limited Partnership of World Point 
Terminals, LP </I></FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT&nbsp;A </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>to the First Amended and 
Restated </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Agreement 
of Limited Partnership of
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>World Point Terminals, LP 
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Certificate Evidencing Common 
Units </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"><B>Representing Limited Partner
Interests in </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>World Point
Terminals, LP </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-
COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">No.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&n
bsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp
; Common Units</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with Section&nbsp;4.1
of the First Amended and Restated Agreement of Limited Partnership of
World Point Terminals, LP, as amended, supplemented or restated from time to 
time (the&nbsp;&#147;<B><I>Partnership Agreement</I></B>&#148;), World Point 
Terminals, LP, a Delaware limited partnership (the 
&#147;<B><I>Partnership</I></B>&#148;),
hereby certifies that
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&n
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (the &#147;<B><I>Holder</I></B>&#148;) 
is the registered owner of Common Units representing limited
partner interests in the Partnership (the &#147;<B><I>Common 
Units</I></B>&#148;) transferable on the books of the Partnership, in person or 
by duly authorized attorney, upon surrender of this Certificate properly 
endorsed. The rights, preferences
and limitations of the Common Units are set forth in, and this Certificate and 
the Common Units represented hereby are issued and shall in all respects be 
subject to the terms and provisions of, the Partnership Agreement. Copies of the
Partnership
Agreement are on file at, and will be furnished without charge on delivery of 
written request to the Partnership at, the principal office of the Partnership 
located at 8235 Forsyth Blvd., Suite 400, St. Louis, Missouri 63105. Capitalized
terms used
herein but not defined shall have the meanings given them in the Partnership 
Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">THE HOLDER OF THIS
SECURITY
ACKNOWLEDGES FOR THE BENEFIT OF WORLD POINT TERMINALS, LP THAT THIS SECURITY MAY
NOT BE TRANSFERRED IF SUCH TRANSFER (AS DEFINED IN THE PARTNERSHIP AGREEMENT) 
WOULD (A)&nbsp;VIOLATE THE THEN APPLICABLE FEDERAL OR STATE SECURITIES LAWS OR 
RULES AND
REGULATIONS OF THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION, ANY STATE SECURITIES 
COMMISSION OR ANY OTHER GOVERNMENTAL AUTHORITY WITH JURISDICTION OVER SUCH 
TRANSFER, (B)&nbsp;TERMINATE THE EXISTENCE OR QUALIFICATION OF WORLD POINT 
TERMINALS, LP UNDER THE
LAWS OF THE STATE OF DELAWARE, OR (C)&nbsp;CAUSE WORLD POINT TERMINALS, LP TO BE
TREATED AS AN ASSOCIATION TAXABLE AS A CORPORATION OR OTHERWISE TO BE TAXED AS 
AN ENTITY FOR FEDERAL INCOME TAX PURPOSES (TO THE EXTENT NOT ALREADY SO TREATED 
OR
TAXED). THE GENERAL PARTNER OF WORLD POINT TERMINALS, LP MAY IMPOSE ADDITIONAL 
RESTRICTIONS ON THE TRANSFER OF THIS SECURITY IF IT RECEIVES AN OPINION OF 
COUNSEL THAT SUCH RESTRICTIONS ARE NECESSARY TO AVOID A SIGNIFICANT RISK OF 
WORLD POINT
TERMINALS, LP BECOMING TAXABLE AS A CORPORATION OR OTHERWISE BECOMING TAXABLE AS
AN ENTITY FOR FEDERAL INCOME TAX PURPOSES. THIS SECURITY MAY BE SUBJECT TO 
ADDITIONAL RESTRICTIONS ON ITS TRANSFER PROVIDED IN THE PARTNERSHIP
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A-1
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
AGREEMENT. COPIES OF SUCH AGREEMENT MAY BE OBTAINED AT NO COST BY WRITTEN 
REQUEST MADE BY THE HOLDER OF RECORD OF THIS SECURITY TO THE SECRETARY OF THE 
GENERAL PARTNER AT THE PRINCIPAL EXECUTIVE
OFFICES OF THE PARTNERSHIP. THE RESTRICTIONS SET FORTH ABOVE SHALL NOT PRECLUDE 
THE SETTLEMENT OF ANY TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING THIS SECURITY ENTERED INTO THROUGH 
THE FACILITIES OF ANY NATIONAL SECURITIES EXCHANGE ON WHICH THIS SECURITY IS 
LISTED OR
ADMITTED TO TRADING. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; 
text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Holder, 
by accepting this Certificate, is deemed to have (i)&nbsp;requested admission 
as, and agreed
to become, a Limited Partner and to have agreed to comply with and be bound by 
and to have executed the Partnership Agreement, (ii)&nbsp;represented and 
warranted that the Holder has all right, power and authority and, if an 
individual, the capacity
necessary to enter into the Partnership Agreement and (iii)&nbsp;made the 
waivers and given the consents and approvals contained in the Partnership 
Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Certificate shall not be valid
for any purpose unless it has been countersigned and registered by the Transfer 
Agent. This Certificate shall be governed by and construed in accordance with 
the laws
of the State of Delaware. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TITLE>EX-10.1</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.1 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CONTRIBUTION, CONVEYANCE AND 
ASSUMPTION </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AGREEMENT 
</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>By and Among </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WORLD POINT TERMINALS, INC. 
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CPT 2010, 
LLC </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WPT GP, LLC </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WORLD POINT TERMINALS, LP 
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AND 
</B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CENTER POINT TERMINAL COMPANY, LLC 
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" 
ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Dated as of [</B><FONT 
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT><B>], 2013 </B></FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CONTRIBUTION, CONVEYANCE AND ASSUMPTION 
AGREEMENT </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This Contribution, Conveyance and Assumption 
Agreement, dated as of [ <FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT> ], 
2013 (this
&#147;<I>Agreement</I>&#148;), is by and among World Point Terminals, LP, a 
Delaware limited partnership (the &#147;<I>Partnership</I>&#148;), WPT GP, LLC, 
a Delaware limited liability company (the &#147;<I>General</I><I> 
Partner</I>&#148;<I>),</I>
World Point Terminals, Inc., a Delaware corporation (&#147;<I>WPTI</I>&#148;), 
CPT 2010, LLC, a Missouri limited liability company (&#147;<I>CPT</I><I> 
2010</I>&#148;<I>),</I> and Center Point Terminal Company, LLC, a Delaware 
limited liability
company (&#147;<I>OLLC</I>&#148;). The above-named entities are sometimes 
referred to in this Agreement each as a &#147;<I>Party</I>&#148; and 
collectively as the &#147;<I>Parties</I>.&#148; Capitalized terms used herein 
shall have the meanings
assigned to such terms in <U>Article I</U>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>RECITALS </U></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B></B> the General Partner and 
WPTI have formed the Partnership, pursuant to the Delaware Revised Uniform 
Limited
Partnership Act (the &#147;<I>Delaware</I><I> LP Act</I>&#148;<I>),</I> for the 
purpose of engaging in any business activity that is approved by the General 
Partner and that lawfully may be conducted by a limited partnership organized 
pursuant to
the Delaware LP Act. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; 
text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B></B> in order to accomplish the objectives and 
purposes in the preceding recital, each
of the following actions has been taken prior to the date hereof: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">WPTI formed the General Partner under the terms of the Delaware Limited
Liability Company Act (the &#147;<I>Delaware LLC Act</I>&#148;<I>)</I> and 
contributed to the
General Partner $1,000 in exchange for all of the limited liability company 
interests in the General Partner. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">The General Partner and WPTI formed the Partnership under the terms of 
the Delaware LP Act and contributed $0 and $1,000 to the Partnership, 
respectively, in exchange
for a 0% non-economic general partner interest and a 100% limited partner 
interest, respectively, in the Partnership. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">St. Albans Global Management, Limited Partnership, LLLP, an affiliate 
of the Novelly family, loaned $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>] to WPTI (the
&#147;<I>St.</I><I> Albans Liability</I>&#148;<I>)</I>. 
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">WPTI acquired the remaining 49% member interest in Center Point 
Terminals Newark, LLC (&#147;<I>CPT Newark</I>&#148;) for
$[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>], including a working 
capital adjustment. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">5.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">Center Point Terminal Company forms Center Point Terminal J&amp;W, LLC 
(&#147;<I>CPT</I><I> J&amp;W</I>&#148;<I>)</I> and contributed $1,000 in 
exchange for all of the
limited liability company interests in CPT J&amp;W. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P

liability company named Center Point Terminal Company, LLC.

SIZE="2">Pelican Island Storage Terminal, Inc. filed a certificate of conversion
under the terms of the Texas Business Organizations Code to convert from a Texas
corporation to
a Texas limited liability company named Pelican Island Storage Terminal, LLC 
(&#147;<I>PISTI</I>&#148;). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-

SIZE="2">OLLC conveyed its interest in the Jacksonville terminal and the Weirton
terminal to CPT J&amp;W as a capital contribution. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

transactions
will occur at the times specified herein: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-

SIZE="2">Each of CPT Newark, Center Point Terminal Baltimore LLC (&#147;<I>CPT

Street</I>&#148;, and together with CPT Newark, CPT Baltimore, CPT Albany and 
PISTI, the &#147;<I>Operating Subsidiaries</I>&#148;) distributes any cash,

other working capital assets owned by the Operating Subsidiaries (the 
&#147;<I>Subsidiary Gross Working Capital</I>&#148;) to OLLC.

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">The agreements of limited partnership and the limited liability company
agreements of certain of the aforementioned entities will be amended and 
restated to the extent
necessary to reflect the applicable matters set forth above and contained in 
this Agreement. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B></B> the members, partners or
stockholders of the Parties have taken all partnership, limited liability 
company or
corporate action, as the case may be, required to approve the transactions 
contemplated by this Agreement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B></B> at the Effective Time, 
the public, through the Underwriters, will purchase from CPT 2010 for $[<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] million in cash, less the amount 
of $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] million payable to the
Underwriters, after taking into account the Underwriters&#146; discount of 
[<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% and the Structuring Fee payable 
to Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner&nbsp;&amp; Smith Incorporated, [<FONT 
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] Common Units (representing a 
[<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% limited partner interest in the 
Partnership). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>, at
the
Effective Time, the public, through the Underwriters, will purchase from the the
Partnership for $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] million 
in cash, less the amount of $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>]
million payable to the Underwriters, after taking into account the 
Underwriters&#146; discount of [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>]% and the Structuring Fee payable to Merrill Lynch, Pierce, 
Fenner&nbsp;&amp; Smith Incorporated,
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] Common Units (representing
a [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% limited partner
interest in the Partnership). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>,<B></B> at the Effective Time, 
the Partnership will (i)&nbsp;pay the Structuring Fee to Merrill Lynch, Pierce
Fenner&nbsp;&amp; Smith Incorporated, (ii)&nbsp;pay the transaction expenses 
related to our new revolving credit facility, estimated to be approximately $
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] million, 
(iii)&nbsp;contribute $[<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] million to OLLC to repay its 
existing debt obligations, (iv)&nbsp;distribute the CPT 2010 Equity Distribution
to CPT 2010, (v)&nbsp;distribute $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>] to
CPT 2010 as reimbursement for its portion of the Structuring Fee, 
(vi)&nbsp;repay existing payables of $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>] and (vii) repay the St. Albans Liability. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOW, THEREFORE,</B> in consideration of the 
mutual covenants, representations, warranties
and agreements herein contained, the parties hereto agree as follows: 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE I </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>DEFINITIONS </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The terms set forth below in this 
<U>Article I</U> shall have the meanings ascribed to them below or in the part 
of this Agreement referred to below: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Agreement</U>&#148; has the meaning 
assigned to such term in the preamble. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Cenex</U>&#148; has the meaning 
assigned to such term in the recitals. </FONT></P>

meaning set forth in <U>Section&nbsp;2.5</U>. </FONT></P>

family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Cenex Interest</U>&#148; has the 
meaning set forth in <U>Section&nbsp;2.10</U>. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Code</U>&#148; means the Internal 
Revenue Code of 1986, as amended and in effect from time to time. Any reference 
herein to a
specific section or sections of the Code shall be deemed to include a reference 
to any corresponding provision of any successor law. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Commission</U>&#148; means
the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. </FONT></P>

Agreement, including pursuant to any exercise of the Over-Allotment Option. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-

Capital</U>&#148; has the meaning assigned to such term in the recitals.
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-

promulgated under the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-

SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Underwriters</U>&#148; means those underwriters listed on 
<U>Schedule I</U> to the
Underwriting Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;
text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Underwriting Agreement</U>&#148; means that certain 
Underwriting Agreement by and among
Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner&nbsp;&amp; Smith Incorporated, [<FONT STYLE="FONT-
FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] and [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>], as representatives of the Underwriters, the General Partner, 
the
Partnership and OLLC dated as of [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>], 2013. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&#147;<U>WPTI</U>&#148; has the
meaning assigned to such term in the preamble. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>WPTI Cenex Contribution Interest</U>&#148; has the

to such term in the recitals. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-

</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>WPTI Contribution 
Interest</U>&#148; has the meaning assigned to such term in the recitals. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>WPTI Newark Contribution 
Interest</U>&#148; has the meaning assigned to such term in the recitals. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE II </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CONTRIBUTION, ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS AND 
DISTRIBUTIONS </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following shall be completed 
immediately following the Effective Time in the order set forth herein: 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section 2.1 </B><B>Distribution 
by the Operating Subsidiaries of Gross Working Capital to OLLC.</B> Each 
Operating Subsidiary hereby distributes, assigns, transfers, sets over and 
delivers to OLLC, its
successors and its assigns, for its and their own use forever, all right, title 
and interest in and to their respective Subsidiary Gross Working Capital. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.2 Distribution by
OLLC of its 100% Limited Liability Company Interest in CPT J&amp;W and the Gross
Working Capital to CPT 2010</B>. OLLC hereby distributes, assigns, transfers, 
sets over
and delivers to CPT 2010, its successors and its assigns, for its and their own
use forever, all right, title and interest in and to its (i)&nbsp;100% limited 
liability company interest in CPT J&amp;W (the &#147;<I>CPT J&amp;W 
Interest</I>&#148;)
and (ii)&nbsp;the Gross Working Capital, and CPT 2010 hereby accepts the CPT 
J&amp;W Interest and the Gross Working Capital (the &#147;<I>OLLC 
Contribution</I>&#148;). Notwithstanding anything in the Limited Liability 
Company Agreement of CPT
J&amp;W, dated as of [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>], 2013
(the &#147;<I>CPT J&amp;W Agreement</I>&#148;) to the contrary, pursuant to the 
OLLC Contribution (i)&nbsp;CPT 2010 is hereby admitted as the sole member of CPT
J&amp;W
and agrees that it is bound by the CPT J&amp;W Agreement, as the sole member of 
CPT J&amp;W, (ii)&nbsp;OLLC hereby ceases to be the sole member of CPT J&amp;W 
immediately following CPT 2010&#146;s admission as described in (i), and 
(iii)&nbsp;CPT
J&amp;W hereby continues without dissolution with CPT 2010 as its sole member. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.3 Contribution by
CPT 2010
of the CPT J&amp;W Contribution Interest to the Partnership</B>. CPT 2010 hereby
grants, contributes, bargains, conveys, assigns, transfers, sets over and 
delivers to the Partnership, its successors and its assigns, for its and their 
own use
forever, all right, title and interest in and to the CPT J&amp;W Contribution 
Interest, as a capital contribution, in exchange for [<FONT STYLE="FONT-
FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] Common Units representing a
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% limited partner interest 
in the Partnership. The Partnership hereby accepts such CPT J&amp;W Contribution
Interest as a contribution to the capital of the Partnership. Notwithstanding 
anything
in the CPT J&amp;W Agreement to the contrary, pursuant to the CPT 2010 
Contribution (i)&nbsp;the Partnership is hereby admitted as the sole member of 
CPT J&amp;W and agrees that it is bound by the CPT J&amp;W Agreement, 
(ii)&nbsp;CPT 2010 hereby
ceases to be the sole member of CPT J&amp;W immediately following the 
Partnership&#146;s admission as described in (i), and (iii)&nbsp;CPT J&amp;W 
hereby continues without dissolution with the Partnership as the sole member. 
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.4 Sale of Common Units by CPT
2010 to the Public</B>.<B></B> The Parties
acknowledge that, public investors, through the Underwriters, have purchased 
from CPT 2010 for approximately $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>] in cash ($[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>] net to CPT 2010 after
deducting the underwriting discounts and commissions of $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-
FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] and the Structuring Fee payable to Merrill 
Lynch, Pierce, Fenner&nbsp;&amp; Smith Incorporated)
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] Common Units, representing
a [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% limited partner 
interest in the Partnership. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.5 Contribution by WPTI of the
WPTI Contribution Interest to the</B> <B>Partnership</B>.<B></B> WPTI hereby 
grants,
contributes, bargains, conveys, assigns, transfers, sets over and delivers to 
the Partnership, its successors and its assigns, for its and their own use
forever, all right, title and interest in and to (i)&nbsp;the WPTI Cenex 
Contribution Interest,
as a capital contribution, in exchange for [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>] Common Units representing a [<FONT STYLE="FONT-
FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% limited partner interest in the Partnership 
and (ii)&nbsp;the WPTI
Newark Contribution Interest, as a capital contribution, in exchange for 
(A)&nbsp;[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] Common Units 
representing a [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% limited 
partner interest in
the Partnership and (B) the assumption by the Partnership of the St. Albans 
Liability. The Partnership hereby (A)&nbsp;accepts each of the WPTI Cenex 
Contribution Interest and the WPTI Newark Contribution Interest as a 
contribution to the capital of
the Partnership, and (B)&nbsp;undertakes to repay the St. Albans Liability (the 
&#147;<I>WPTI Contribution</I>&#148;). Notwithstanding anything in the Limited 
Liability Company Agreement of Cenex, dated as of
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] (the &#147;<I>Cenex 
Agreement</I>&#148;), or the Limited Liability Company Agreement of CPT Newark, 
dated as of [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] (the 
&#147;<I>CPT Newark
Agreement</I>&#148;) to the contrary, as applicable, pursuant to the WPTI 
Contribution (i)&nbsp;the Partnership is hereby admitted as a member of Cenex 
and the sole member of CPT Newark and agrees that it is bound by the Cenex 
Agreement and CPT
Newark Agreement, (ii)&nbsp;WPTI hereby ceases to be a member of each of Cenex 
and CPT Newark immediately following the Partnership&#146;s admission to each as
described in (i), and (iii)&nbsp;both Cenex and CPT Newark hereby continue 
without
dissolution with the Partnership as a member of each. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.6 Contribution by CPT 2010 of
the CPT 2010
Contribution Interest to the Partnership</B>.<B></B> CPT 2010 hereby grants, 
contributes, bargains, conveys, assigns, transfers, sets over and delivers to 
the Partnership, its successors and its assigns, for its and their own use 
forever, all right,
title and interest in and to the CPT 2010 Contribution Interest, as a capital 
contribution, in exchange for (i)&nbsp;[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>] Common Units representing a
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% limited partner interest 
in the Partnership, (ii)&nbsp;[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>] Subordinated Units representing a
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% limited partner interest 
in the Partnership and (iii)&nbsp;the right to receive the CPT 2010 Equity 
Distribution, a portion of which will be used to reimburse CPT 2010 for certain 
capital
expenditures it incurred with respect to the contributed assets pursuant to 
Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.707-4(d). The Partnership hereby 
(A)&nbsp;accepts such CPT 2010 Contribution Interest as a contribution to the 
capital of the Partnership,
and (B)&nbsp;undertakes to distribute the CPT 2010 Equity Distribution to CPT 
2010 as contemplated in clause (iii)&nbsp;of this <U>Section&nbsp;2.5</U> (the 
&#147;<I>CPT 2010 Contribution</I>&#148;). Notwithstanding anything in the 
Limited Liability
Company Agreement of OLLC, dated as of [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 
2">&#151;</FONT>] (the &#147;<I>OLLC Agreement</I>&#148;) to the contrary, 
pursuant to the CPT 2010 Contribution (i)&nbsp;the Partnership is hereby 
admitted as the sole
member of OLLC and agrees that it is bound by the OLLC Agreement, (ii)&nbsp;CPT 
2010 hereby ceases to be the sole member of OLLC immediately following the 
Partnership&#146;s admission as described in (i), and (iii)&nbsp;OLLC hereby 
continues without
dissolution with the Partnership as the sole member. </FONT></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.7 Issuance of Incentive 
Distribution Rights to WPTI</B>.<B></B> The
Partnership agrees to issue 20% of its Incentive Distribution Rights to WPTI. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.8 Issuance of 
Incentive
Distribution Rights</B>.<B></B> The Partnership agrees to issue 60% of its 
Incentive Distribution Rights to PAN. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.9 Issuance of Incentive 
Distribution Rights to Apex</B>.<B></B> The Partnership agrees to issue 20% of 
its Incentive
Distribution Rights to Apex. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.10 Conveyance by the Partnership of the CPT J&amp;W 
Interest, its 32% Limited
Liability Company Interest in Cenex and its 49% Limited Liability Company 
Interest in CPT Newark to OLLC</B>.<B></B> The Partnership hereby grants, 
contributes, bargains, conveys, assigns, transfers, sets over and delivers to 
OLLC, its successors
and its assigns, for its and their own use forever, all right, title and 
interest in and to (i)&nbsp;the CPT J&amp;W Interest, (ii) its 32% limited 
liability company interest in Cenex (the &#147;<I>Cenex 
Interest</I>&#148;<I>)</I> and (iii)&nbsp;its
49% limited liability company interest in CPT Newark (the &#147;<I>CPT</I><I> 
Newark Interest</I>&#148;<I>),</I> in each case as a capital contribution, and 
OLLC hereby accepts the CPT J&amp;W Interest, the Cenex Interest and the CPT 
Newark Interest
(the &#147;<I>Partnership</I><I> Contribution</I>&#148;<I>)</I>. Notwithstanding
anything in the CPT J&amp;W Agreement, the Cenex Agreement or the CPT Newark 
Agreement to the contrary, as applicable, pursuant to the Partnership 
Contribution,
(i)&nbsp;the OLLC is hereby admitted as a member of each of CPT J&amp;W, Cenex 
and CPT Newark and agrees that it is bound by the CPT J&amp;W Agreement, the 
Cenex Agreement and the CPT Newark Agreement, as a member of Cenex and the sole 
member of
each of CPT J&amp;W and CPT Newark, respectively, (ii)&nbsp;the Partnership 
ceases to be a member of each of CPT J&amp;W, Cenex and CPT Newark immediately 
following OLLC&#146;s admission to each as described in (i), and (iii)&nbsp;each
of CPT
J&amp;W, Cenex and CPT Newark hereby continue without dissolution with OLLC as a
member of each. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.11 Public
Cash Contribution</B>.<B></B> The Parties acknowledge that, in connection with 
the initial public offering, public investors, through the Underwriters, have 
made a capital contribution to the Partnership of approximately $[<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] in cash ($[<FONT STYLE="FONT-
FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] net to the Partnership after deducting the 
underwriting discounts and commissions of
$[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] and the Structuring Fee 
payable to Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner&nbsp;&amp; Smith Incorporated) in 
exchange for the issuance by the Partnership of
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] Common Units, representing
a [<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]% limited partner 
interest in the Partnership. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.12 Payment of the Structuring
Fee</B>.<B></B> Each of the Partnership and CPT 2010 agree to pay Merrill Lynch,
Pierce,
Fenner&nbsp;&amp; Smith Incorporated the Structuring Fee; <I>provided, 
however,</I> the Partnership agrees to reimburse CPT 2010 for its portion of the
Structuring Fee. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.13 Payment of 
Transaction Costs</B>.<B></B> The Parties acknowledge the payment by the 
Partnership of transaction expenses in the amount of approximately $[<FONT
STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>]. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.14 Distribution of Equity 
Distribution</B>.<B></B> The
Partnership hereby distributes the CPT 2010 Equity Distribution to CPT 2010. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.15 Repayment of 
St. Albans
Liability</B>.<B></B> The Parties acknowledge the repayment of the St. Albans 
Liability by OLLC with a portion of the proceeds described in 
<U>Section&nbsp;2.11</U> and contributed to OLLC. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section 2.16 Contribution of Proceeds to 
OLLC</B>. The Parties acknowledge the
contribution of offering proceeds in the amount of $[<FONT STYLE="FONT-
FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] to OLLC. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.17 Repayment of Existing Debt
Obligations by OLLC</B>.<B></B> The Parties acknowledge the repayment of the 
existing
debt obligations by OLLC with a portion of the proceeds described in 
<U>Section&nbsp;2.11</U> and contributed to OLLC. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;2.18 Redemption of WPTI&#146;s 
Initial Limited Partner Interests</B>.<B></B> For and in consideration of the 
redemption
by the Partnership of $1,000 to WPTI as a refund of their initial capital 
contribution to the Partnership, along with 100.0% of any interest or profit 
that resulted from the investment or other use of such capital contribution, the
Partnership
hereby redeems all of the initial limited partner interests of WPTI. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE III </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ADDITIONAL TRANSACTIONS </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the Over-Allotment Option is 
exercised in whole or in part, the Underwriters will contribute additional cash 
to the Partnership in exchange for up to an additional
[<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:WINGDINGS 2">&#151;</FONT>] Common Units on the basis 
of the initial public offering price per Common Unit set forth in the 
Registration Statement less the amount of underwriting discounts and commissions
and Structuring
Fee, and the Partnership shall use the net proceeds from that exercise to redeem
from WPTI the number of Common Units issued upon such exercise. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE IV </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FURTHER ASSURANCES </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">From time to time after the Effective Time, and
without any further consideration, the Parties agree to execute, acknowledge and
deliver
all such additional deeds, assignments, bills of sale, conveyances, instruments,
notices, releases, acquittances and other documents, and to do all such other 
acts and things, all in accordance with applicable law, as may be necessary or 
appropriate
(i)&nbsp;more fully to assure that the applicable Parties own all of the 
properties, rights, titles, interests, estates, remedies, powers and privileges 
granted by this Agreement, or which are intended to be so granted, 
(ii)&nbsp;more fully and
effectively to vest in the applicable Parties and their respective successors 
and assigns beneficial and record title to the interests contributed and 
assigned by this Agreement or intended to be so and (iii)&nbsp;more fully and 
effectively to carry
out the purposes and intent of this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE V </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EFFECTIVE TIME </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notwithstanding anything contained 
in this Agreement to the contrary, none of the provisions of <U>Article II</U> 
of this Agreement shall be operative or have any effect until the Effective 
Time, at which
time all the provisions of <U>Article II</U> of this Agreement shall be 
effective and operative in accordance with <U>Article VI</U>, without further 
action by any Party hereto. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE VI </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>MISCELLANEOUS </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.1 Order of 
Completion of Transactions</B>.<B></B> The transactions provided for in 
<U>Article II</U> and <U>Article III</U> of this Agreement shall be completed 
immediately following the
Effective Time in the following order: first, the transactions provided for in 
<U>Article II </U>shall be completed in the order set forth therein; and second,
following the completion of the transactions provided for in <U>Article II</U>, 
the
transactions provided for in Article III, if they occur, shall be completed. 
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.2 Headings; References; 
Interpretation</B>.<B></B> All Article and Section
headings in this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not be deemed to 
control or affect the meaning or construction of any of the provisions hereof. 
The words &#147;hereof,&#148; &#147;herein&#148; and &#147;hereunder&#148; and 
words of
similar import, when used in this Agreement, shall refer to this Agreement as a 
whole, including, without limitation, all Schedules and Exhibits attached 
hereto, and not to any particular provision of this Agreement. All references
herein to
Articles, Sections, Schedules and Exhibits shall, unless the context requires a 
different construction, be deemed to be references to the Articles and Sections 
of this Agreement and the Schedules and Exhibits attached hereto, and all such 
Schedules
and Exhibits attached hereto are hereby incorporated herein and made a part 
hereof for all purposes. All personal pronouns used in this Agreement, whether 
used in the masculine, feminine or neuter gender shall include all other 
genders, and the
singular shall include the plural and vice versa. The use herein of the word 
&#147;including&#148; following any general statement, term or matter shall not 
be construed to limit such statement, term or matter to the specific items or 
matters set
forth immediately following such word or to similar items or matters, whether or
not non-limiting language (such as &#147;without limitation&#148;, &#147;but not
limited to&#148;, or words of similar import) is used with reference thereto, 
but
rather shall be deemed to refer to all other items or matters that could 
reasonably fall within the broadest possible scope of such general statement, 
term or matter. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.3 Successors and 
Assigns</B>.<B></B> This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the 
benefit of the Parties and their respective successors and assigns. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.4 No Third Party 
Rights</B>.<B></B> The provisions of this Agreement are intended to bind the 
Parties as to each other
and are not intended to and do not create rights in any other person or confer 
upon any other person any benefits, rights or remedies, and no person is or is 
intended to be a third party beneficiary of any of the provisions of this 
Agreement.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.5 
Counterparts</B>.<B></B> This Agreement may be executed in any number of 
counterparts with the same
effect as if all signatory Parties had signed the same document. All 
counterparts shall be construed together and shall constitute one and the same 
instrument. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.6 Choice of 
Law</B>.<B></B> This Agreement shall be subject to and governed by the laws of 
the state of Delaware. Each Party hereby submits to the jurisdiction of the 
state and federal
courts in the state of Missouri and to venue in the state and federal courts in 
St. Louis County, Missouri. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.7 Severability</B>.<B></B> If
any of the provisions of this Agreement are held by any court of competent 
jurisdiction
to contravene, or to be invalid under, the laws of any political body having 
jurisdiction over the subject matter hereof, such contravention or invalidity 
shall not invalidate the entire Agreement. Instead, this Agreement shall be 
construed as if it
did not contain the particular provisions or provisions held to be invalid and 
an equitable adjustment shall be made and necessary provision added so as to 
give effect to the intention of the Parties as expressed in this Agreement at 
the time of
execution of this Agreement. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.8 Amendment or 
Modification</B>. This Agreement may be amended or modified
from time to time only by the written agreement of all the Parties. Each such 
instrument shall be reduced to writing and shall be designated on its face as an
amendment to this Agreement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.9 Integration</B>. This 
Agreement and the instruments referenced herein supersede all previous 
understandings or
agreements among the Parties, whether oral or written, with respect to the 
subject matter of this Agreement and such instruments. This Agreement and such 
instruments contain the entire understanding of the Parties with respect to the 
subject matter
hereof and thereof. No understanding, representation, promise or agreement, 
whether oral or written, is intended to be or shall be included in or form part 
of this Agreement unless it is contained in a written amendment hereto executed 
by the
parties hereto after the date of this Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Section&nbsp;6.10 Deed; Bill of Sale; Assignment</B>. To the 
extent
required and permitted by applicable law, this Agreement shall also constitute a
&#147;deed,&#148; &#147;bill of sale&#148; or &#147;assignment&#148; of the 
assets and interests referenced herein. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I></I>[<I>Signature Page Follows</I>]<I> 
</I></FONT></P>

STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>IN WITNESS WHEREOF</B>,<B></B> the parties 
to this Agreement have caused it to be duly
executed as of the date first above written. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-
